conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway 3D isometric render with volumetric rooms, visible wall height/thickness, and multiple wall faces (top/side) visible.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion of walls with thickness; floors read as separate planes; interior volume is evident. Minor simplification/softness in some corner junctions and cut edges.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency largely match (kitchen/dining left, living central, two bedrooms right, bath central-lower, hall core). Some local wall/partition placements and proportions appear slightly shifted/simplified versus the 2D plan, especially around the hall/bath/closet/laundry cluster.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present (dining table, sofa/coffee table, beds). Bathroom fixture(s) represented. Kitchen is simplified and not fully detailed relative to the 2D plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation and readable geometry; lighting is sufficient to see interior. Some areas are slightly washed out/low-contrast, reducing opening/door readability.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout/proportion deviations and simplification around central hall/bath/closet/laundry partitions compared to the 2D plan.
Not all doors/windows are clearly verifiable as matching exact 2D positions due to simplified openings and viewing angle.
Kitchen and utility/laundry elements are simplified; fixture-level fidelity is lower than the plan depiction.
Low material contrast in some interior areas slightly reduces clarity of wall/opening boundaries.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall layout fidelity, with only minor proportional/partition and opening-detail mismatches versus the 2D plan.
